description.default: Sends and receives IR signals using the USB-UIRT transceiver IR received will generate an [[event]]. IR codes are sent using the Pronto code format. Learning mode allows Pronto codes to be learned and stored.

info.parameter: The minimum length of the learned code that is considered valid

description.default: Puts the USB-UIRT into learn mode. Codes will be learned in Pronto mode. When a code is learned, an event will be generated with the code as payload {1}. If the code is shorter than <MinLength> the event name will be: UUIRT.LearnTooShort Otherwise the event name will be: UUIRT.LearnComplete
Cancels learning mode and returns the USB-UIRT to normal mode of operation.

info.parameter: True means blink when sending IR
True means blink when receiving IR

description.default: Enter True or False for each parameter to set how the device will blink when sending and receiving IR signals.

info.parameter: The minimum length of the learned code that is considered valid

description.default: Puts the USB-UIRT into learn mode. Codes will be learned in UUIRT mode (shorter codes). When a code is learned, an event will be generated with the code as payload {1}. If the code is shorter than <MinLength> the event name will be: UUIRT.LearnTooShort Otherwise the event name will be: UUIRT.LearnComplete

info.parameter: Can be UUIRT or Pronto format

description.default: Sends (blasts) the infrared code specified by <IR Code>. Sends the code <Repeat> times.
